title: Circuits - power in A and C if RC greater than RA

content.question:
Show all your work for each part of the question. The parts within the question may not have equal weight.

The figure shows a circuit comprised of a battery of <math alttext="e m f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>emf</mtext></math> <math alttext="delta V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>V</mi></math> and three resistors, <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>, <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, and <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> with resistances <math alttext="R sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub></math>, <math alttext="R sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub></math>, and <math alttext="R sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></msub></math>, respectively.

(a) Consider the case where <math alttext="R sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></msub></math> is greater than <math alttext="R sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub></math>. Indicate how the power <math alttext="P sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub></math> dissipated in Resistor <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> compares to the power <math alttext="P sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></msub></math> dissipated in Resistor <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>.
_____<math alttext="P sub A is greater than P sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></msub><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace></math>_____<math alttext="P sub A equals P sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></msub><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace></math>_____<math alttext="P sub A is less than P sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></msub></math>
Without deriving or manipulating equations, justify your selection.

frqParts.text:
Show all your work for each part of the question. The parts within the question may not have equal weight.

The figure shows a circuit comprised of a battery of <math alttext="e m f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>emf</mtext></math> <math alttext="delta V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>V</mi></math> and three resistors, <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>, <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, and <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> with resistances <math alttext="R sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub></math>, <math alttext="R sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub></math>, and <math alttext="R sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></msub></math>, respectively.

(a) Consider the case where <math alttext="R sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></msub></math> is greater than <math alttext="R sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub></math>. Indicate how the power <math alttext="P sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub></math> dissipated in Resistor <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> compares to the power <math alttext="P sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></msub></math> dissipated in Resistor <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>.
_____<math alttext="P sub A is greater than P sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></msub><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace></math>_____<math alttext="P sub A equals P sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></msub><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace></math>_____<math alttext="P sub A is less than P sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></msub></math>
Without deriving or manipulating equations, justify your selection.

(b) Derive an equation for the ratio <math alttext="the fraction with numerator P sub A, and denominator P sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></msub></mfrac></math> in terms of <math alttext="delta V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></math>, <math alttext="R sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub></math>, <math alttext="R sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub></math>, <math alttext="R sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></msub></math>, and physical constants, as appropriate.

(c) Is the equation for <math alttext="the fraction with numerator P sub A, and denominator P sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></msub></mfrac></math> you derived in part (b) consistent with the relation you selected in part (a)? Justify why they either are or are not consistent.

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
